name: Hotel Curious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Curious was an excellent choice from T/A recommendations. We stayed here 6 nights in total. Room 404 was quiet, tastefully decorated with a little balcony (ideal for drying washing!) Although a small room it was adequate, very clean and serviced. Breakfast was fresh and delicious. The hotel staff were friendly and informative. The location was perfect - close to La Rambla & La Boqueria Market. We loved it here.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel / Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is amazing how this old building has been so cleverly renovated. If you stay here take the time to study the pictures in the foyer! Although our taxi driver had difficulty locating the hotel as it is tucked into a side street just off Las Ramblas, the location was ideal, quiet and close to the Liceu underground station. Our room was not large but very well equipped with a small balcony, well screened from the adjoining building. The bed was comfortable for us and air conditioning was helpful in the heat. Although the breakfast room was 'basement', clever lighting and bright murals made it cheerful. The choice of food was good and staff attentive. Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly, giving good information on sights and travel.
reviews.title: The best little Hotel!

reviews.text: stayed at hotel curious two years ago, and was more than happy with my booking. the property is just a short walk from las ramblas, and not far from the gothic quarter. clean, neat rooms, but try to get a room facing the street, good for people watching. we have in fact, booked to stay there again this september, so i have no problems recommending this hotel louise newcastle australia
reviews.title: great location, great hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is right off Las Ramblas in a terrific location. We would have given this property 5 stars were it not for the rock hard beds!!! Terrific bathroom/deep tub. The staff was very attentive and helpful and the breakfast just right!
reviews.title: Great location, terrible beds!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights. We were greeted by a very cheery and helpful man on reception who provided a great first impression. Our room was small, but clean, cosy, and with a little balcony. The air conditioning was a life saver in the July heat. The shower was decent sized. Breakfast was included in the price, and was served buffet style with lots of fruit, croissants, toast and cereal. The location is excellent, literally a minute away from the main hub of the city. The best thing about this hotel was definitely the bed. If you like a firm comfy bed, you will have a great sleep here! I only give it four stars as on the first morning I awoke and discovered a bed bug on my top and another on the sheet, but there were none to be found after that.
reviews.title: Great location, perfect for short stay!

reviews.text: Pluses - great location just near La Boqueria food market and also close to Placa Cataluyna metro, friendly and helpful staff, clean room. A few minuses as well, though: was not good value, I had a small single room, no daylight (window looked straight out onto a wall, albeit with poster of Barcelona view and articifially lit!) squeaky bed (base like a folding bed, although comfortable mattress) no cupboards or anywhere to put stuff, and breakfast was mediocre, coffee like mud although you did have the option to pay extra for espresso.
reviews.title: Well located hotel near La Rambla

reviews.text: I needed a last minute hotel room for an unexpected 2 nights in Barcelona, and Hotel Curious had availability, and was offering an attractive last minute deal. As I was traveling solo, the single room they gave me was small, but clean & efficient. The front desk was extremely helpful and nice-- all staff seemed to speak English well. The breakfast is very simple, and don't expect too many amenities like a wide selection of provided toiletries. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable place to sleep near La Rambla.
reviews.title: Affordable Option with Central Location

reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience at Hotel Curious. It is rated highly on Trip Advisor for a reason. The staff couldn't be more helpful, and the rooms were well equipped and clean. The location was the best, very close to the Metro station, bus stop, and La Rambla!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and lovely staff!!!!
overrated
reviews.text: not sure why this place got such great reviews. rooms are small, beds hard and uncomfortable, bathroom with major toiletry shortage (enough shampoo for half of my hair). good location and helpful staff though.

Hotel Curious is located just off Las Ramblas- the epicenter of fun, culture and food in Barcelona! The Hotel is clean, comfortable, spacious and well maintained. Breakfast is really great- yougurt, fruit, make your own panini's, cheese/bread/meats, strong coffee and tea. Hot tea is available all day long as well. The staff is really wonderful, super helpful, friendly, cheerful. Metro stations are close by so everything is easy to get to. We stayed here with our 3 children and had a triple room and a double and everyone was happy. I would stay again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for a short stay. It's location is brilliant, literally just off Las Ramblas, a 5-10 minute walk to the port and 2 minutes to the main plaza where you can catch the sightseeing buses. Hotels in Barcelona seem to be expensive but this was one of the cheapest and just what we wanted. The price also included a small continental breakfast buffet, but with more than enough choice of breads, yoghurts, fruits etc. The rooms were fairly small but plenty big enough if you are just using it as a base. Rooms were modern and clean with free wifi and TV. Reception staff spoke good English and helpful if called upon. Overall, this was excellent value for Barcelona. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: We wanted to be on or near Las Ramblas and this was the place. It is maybe a half of a block off. It is very expensive to stay anywhere in Barcelona, especially near Las Ramblas, and this was the best deal we could find. AND we loved this hotel. Very clean and the staff was great! Very helpful with all of our questions. TIP: we had a room with a double bed and a room with 2 singles, and the room with 2 singles was much bigger: so get a room with 2 singles. If you want a great hotel with a good rate near Las Ramblas, stay here.
reviews.title: Great place to stay just off Las Ramblas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice central hotel. Just a couple of minutes from La Rambla but still quiet. Modern, clean facilities and a great breakfast. Hotle staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would recommend and stay again next time
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying here for 3 nights end June/July, thanks to finding on Tripadvisor. Rooms are just the right size for a 3 night stay. I echo what every positive review has said about this hotel, fab location, great staff, free wifi, very clean. My only criticism is that there is no room safe and we found the bed a little too hard, otherwise a great hotel, and perfect location.
reviews.title: A great little hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location just off La Rambla, and within walking distance or a short taxi ride to everything. Hotel staff is very pleasant, and the breakfast was adequate. Our room was large and clean if a bit stark in decor, and the bathroom is decen sized and modern. Wireless internet worked very well in our room. On the down side, the beds are very hard, and, as previous reviewers have mentioned, if you have a twin room (which are all in the front of the hotel) there can be quite a bit of noise at night. Our first two nights (a Wednesday and Thursday) there were noisy people going by all hours of the night. We were not there for the weekend, but returned Sunday night and were again kept awake until about 2 am. The next two nights were somewhat quieter. The noise seemed to be mostly loud intoxicated people (and occasionally cars) making their way between La Rambla and El Raval. If you can get a room in the back of the hotel , or can sleep through anything, then this is a great place, but if you need a twin room, and are a light sleeper, I would look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great location, but front rooms can be noisy

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the hotel and had a good time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good - just off the Rambla on a small street. Hotel and rooms are tiny, but clean and functional. Breakfast was basic and fine for us - so was the free WiFi. We paid 130 euros pr. Night which was far too expensive for that type of hotel compared to a lot of other cities, but seems like it is the price level in Barcelona
reviews.title: Small but nice rooms. Excellent location but expensive rather expensive

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights upon arrival In Barcelona. As others have said, the staff is great, especially Mateo. Our room and bathroom in th rear were pretty tiny, but our friends' on the street were larger, and they reported no noise. Speaking of the street, it is one way and narrow with no loading zone, meaning your car or taxi will block all traffic, so you must be hasty.
reviews.title: Good value & location in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location in the Gothic Quarter is convenient to many things. The free breakfast is good, and there is free wifi.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel, brilliant staff and a fab location!!

reviews.text: I had booked this hotel on the reviews I'd seen on Tripadvisor and it was everything that other guests had described. The rooms are compact, very clean and tidy and the air con works perfectly. La Rambla was just a short stroll away as was the port, the hotel is in the most perfect location. The price of the hotel was very good value for money, with a fresh breakfast buffet laid out everyday, which was constanlty being restocked. I cant wait to re-visit Barcelona again and I will certainly be booking a room at Hotel Curious without any hesitatio. I would certainly recommend this to friends, family or anyone thinking of visiting this wonderful city.
reviews.title: Perfect spot in the heart of La Rambla

reviews.text: Great little hotel literally in the heart of La Rambla. The rooms are small but that is true of most hotels in Europe. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Everyone spoke English as well as Spanish and oftentimes several other languages. It serves a morning breakfast that has the basics covered (coffee, tea, juice, eggs, pastry). The hotel is very clean and they have taken a very small space and added little design features to make it feel a bit more upscale. We particularly want to thank Matteo who was at the front desk both nights we stayed there. He was so warm and friendly he made the stay even better.
reviews.title: Great location, price and helpful staff

description: Hotel Curious is your new Hotel in Barcelona city center. A completely new and comfortable hotel in the center of Barcelona where you can live an experience both outside and inside the hotel. You will see that the walls of the rooms are decorated with large pictures of places and monuments of Barcelona. Its design is inspired by the four elements: Water, Earth, Fire and Air. A cheap, unique and familiar hotel at once.Our rooms are fully equipped: WI-FI, Air-conditioning, flat screen TV satellite, radio... Reached on foot from downtown Barcelona very near Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, the Cathedral, the Gothic Quarter, the Port, the Mercat de la Boqueria and many other sights and tourist attractions, also thanks to the wide availability of public transport, with which you can move easily from the center of Barcelona to all parts of the city. Hotel Curious will make you discover the most interesting and innovative sites of Barcelona.
